meanings.def: a flat, usually round, dish that you put food on
examples: sandwiches on a plate
There was an enormous pile of dirty plates in the kitchen sink.
The set includes four dinner plates, four side plates and four soup bowls.
They filled their plates with spaghetti.
I could see how hungry she was from the way she cleared her plate.
She ate everything on her plate.
He barely touched the food on his plate.
He came in carrying a plate of sandwiches.
We used plastic cutlery and ate off paper plates.

meanings.def: the amount of food that you can put on a plate
examples: a plate of sandwiches
two large plates of pasta
At dinner, Paul ate several plates of stew.

meanings.def: a whole main course of a meal, served on one plate
examples: Try the seafood plate.

meanings.def: a thin flat piece of metal, used especially to join or make something stronger
examples: The tanks were mainly constructed of steel plates.
She had a metal plate inserted in her arm.

meanings.def: a flat piece of metal with some information on it, for example somebody’s name
examples: A brass plate beside the door said ‘Dr Alan Tate’.

meanings.def: the pieces of metal or plastic at the front and back of a vehicle with numbers and letters on it
ordinary metal that is covered with a thin layer of silver or gold
examples: The cutlery is plate, not solid silver.

meanings.def: dishes, bowls, etc. that are made of silver or gold
examples: the family plate

meanings.def: one of the thin flat pieces of horn or bone that cover and protect an animal
examples: the armadillo’s protective shell of bony plates

meanings.def: one of the very large pieces of rock that form the earth’s surface and move slowly
examples: the Pacific plate
Earthquakes are caused by two tectonic plates bumping into each other.

meanings.def: a photograph that is used as a picture in a book, especially one that is printed on a separate page on high quality paper
examples: The book includes 55 colour plates.
See plate 4.
She looked like a fashion plate.

meanings.def: a sheet of metal, plastic, etc. that has been treated so that words or pictures can be printed from it
examples: a printing plate

meanings.def: a thin sheet of glass, metal, etc. that is covered with chemicals so that it reacts to light and can form an image, used in larger or older cameras
a thin piece of plastic with wire or artificial teeth attached to it which fits inside your mouth in order to make your teeth straight
the place where the person hitting the ball stands and where they must return to after running around all the bases
a flat dish that is used to collect money from people in a church
to give something to somebody without that person making any effort
examples: Nobody's going to hand you success on a plate.

meanings.def: to have a lot of work or problems, etc. to deal with
to do what is necessary in order to benefit from an opportunity or deal with a crisis
examples: It's important for world leaders to step up to the plate and honor their commitments on global warming.
It’s time for businesses to step up to the plate and accept responsibility.

idioms.idiom: hand something to somebody on a plate
idioms.def: to give something to somebody without that person making any effort
examples: Nobody's going to hand you success on a plate.

idioms.idiom: have enough/a lot/too much on your plate
idioms.def: to have a lot of work or problems, etc. to deal with
to do what is necessary in order to benefit from an opportunity or deal with a crisis
examples: It's important for world leaders to step up to the plate and honor their commitments on global warming.
It’s time for businesses to step up to the plate and accept responsibility.

meanings.def: to cover a metal with a thin layer of another metal, especially gold or silver
examples: be plated (with something) a silver ring plated with gold
platinum-plated jewellery

meanings.def: to cover something with sheets of metal or another hard substance
examples: be plated (with something) The walls of the vault were plated with steel.
nickel-plated wire
